metadata.title: CVE-2017-5967 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The time subsystem in the Linux kernel through 4.9.9, whenCONFIG_TIMER_STATS is enabled, allows local users to discover real PIDvalues (as distinguished from PID values inside a PID namespace) by readingthe /proc/timer_list file, related to the print_timer function inkernel/time/timer_list.c and the __timer_stats_timer_set_start_infofunction in kernel/time/timer.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5967` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.4.0-207.239
linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-207.239
linux-image-4.2.0-16-lowlatency - 4.4.0-207.239
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-207.239
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-207.239
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-207.239
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-207.239
linux-image-extra-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.4.0-207.239
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1150-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1150.161
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-26-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2

linux-image-4.13.0-26-lowlatency - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-26-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1091-kvm - 4.4.0-1091.100

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-207.239').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
